statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.headline: Vermont 83, Boston U. 69
article.story: BURLINGTON, Vt. -- Four McGlynn scored 20 points and Matt Glass added 19 as Vermont defeated Boston University 83-69 in an America East Conference game Thursday night. The Catamounts (7-9, 1-1), coming off a 65-59 league loss at Stony Brook, won their home opener for the 11th time in their last 12 tries. Brian Voelkel matched his career high with 16 rebounds as Vermont outrebounded the Terriers 42-31. BU, the America East preseason favorite, led by five early, but the Catamounts used a 9-0 run to pull ahead for good. After the Terriers (4-11, 0-1) got to 35-32, Brendan Bald's 3 sparked a 6-0 run and BU could get no closer than five after that. Luke Apfeld added 13 points for Vermont, which shot 26 of 57 from the field and 25 of 31 from the line. Darryl Partin's 19 points paced BU, which has lost 10 of its last 13 to Vermont.
